name: @local/app
author: <akauppi@gmail.com>
--: -- following stuff matters for development, only --

scripts.test: concurrently --kill-others --success=first -n dev,cy "npm run dev:local" "wait-on http://localhost:3000 && cypress run"
scripts.dev:local: concurrently --kill-others-on-fail -n emul,init "firebase emulators:start --project=app --only auth,functions,firestore" "(export GCLOUD_PROJECT=app; npm run --silent _dev_local_init && npm run --silent _dev_local_vite)"
scripts.predev:local: npm run --silent _checkFirebaseEmulVer && (PORT=3000 npm run --silent _checkPortIsFree) && npm run --silent _genEnvLocal
scripts.//predev:online: npm run --silent _checkFirebaseActiveProj && (PORT=3001 npm run --silent _checkPortIsFree) && npm run --silent _genEnvOnline
scripts._checkFirebaseEmulVer:
tools/firebase-ver-check.sh 8.15.0 || ( >&2 echo "Please install 'firebase-tools' 8.15.0 or later.
"; exit 8)
scripts.//_checkFirebaseActiveProj:
[[ $(firebase use | cat) != *"No active project"* ]] || ( >&2 echo "ERROR: No active project. Please run 'firebase use <alias>' or 'firebase use --add'.
"; exit 1)
scripts._checkPortIsFree:
tools/port-is-free.sh $PORT || ( >&2 echo "ERROR: Port '$PORT' is taken!
"; exit 6)
scripts._checkNoLinks:
tools/check-no-links.sh || ( >&2 echo "ERROR: 'npm' links not allowed in a production build. Use them only at development.
	Use 'npm list' to see them; 'npm unlink x; npm install' to remove.
"; exit 8)

predev:local: 'firebase' CLI version (>= 8.15.0) matters for the use of auth emulation.

@vue/compiler-sfc: This needs to be the same version as 'dependencies.vue' but did not find a way to enforce that.
prettier: tbd. why do we have it? Keep, but mention here.
sass: Needed as a peer dep, since we use '<style scoped lang=scss>' in the application. Otherwise, there's a RED dialog

in the browser: '[plugin:vite:css] Preprocessor dependency "sass" not found. Did you install it?
'

files: Leaving intentionally out Firebase (and tslib); index.html; those are provided by the production build.
engines: '--experimental-json-modules' seems to be available for Node 12
